title: Fork, early 17th century
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description: Fork has four, slightly curved tines, rounded shoulders. Flat flaring neck, octagonal metal socket with twisted wire at edges. Carved wooden handle with four figures; Faith, Hope, Charity and Justice with their attributes, surmounted by scrolls, shell with bird and figure of cherub riding a lion. Around bottom of handle: "IK.LEEF.OP.HOOP" (I am living on hope.) Engraved on socket: KID

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Fork, early 17th century.
early 17th century. Wood, steel. The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg. 1985-103-52.
